Descriptive: Winter had arrived in full force, as evidenced by the slow, gradual melting of the snow. The once pristine white blanket covering the landscape was now starting to give way to patches of brown grass peeking through. The air was crisp and cold, with a sharpness that cut through to the bone. People bundled up in thick coats, scarves, and gloves, bracing themselves against the chilly winds that blew through the streets. Winter was here, and there was no denying its presence. It was a season of cold, of stillness, and of quiet beauty. As the snow continued to melt, revealing the world beneath, it was a reminder that even in the coldest of times, there was still warmth and life waiting to emerge.

Saeng failed her driver's test after purchasing a plant called "dok faeng ñ noi" at "Flour Is It." The plant brought back memories of Vietnam where it was commonly seen. To comfort herself, Saeng bought a hibiscus plant, reminiscing about its presence in her past. She made a silent vow to retake the test in the spring when the hibiscus blooms, symbolizing new beginnings. Saeng realized that opportunities arise repeatedly, akin to the migration of geese and the changing seasons. She resolved to seize the chance to retake the test when it next presented itself.

Saeng silently vowed to herself that in the spring, when the snow melts and the geese return, and the hibiscus begins budding, she will take the driving test again. Just as the environment around her undergoes changes and transitions, she too will thrive and return to her old self. When she is ready to open up and embrace new opportunities, like the geese coming home and the hibiscus blooming, she will be prepared to pass the test.

Throughout the story "Winter Hibiscus," the author conveys a sense of hope and comfort that Saeng derives from reflecting on the past. This feeling of hope is further reinforced in the final sentence, suggesting that Saeng's future will be brighter than her initial struggles in a new country. Initially feeling alienated and misplaced, Saeng gradually finds peace of mind and confidence in herself as the narrative unfolds. Ultimately, the author leaves readers with a sense of optimism for Saeng's future and her growing sense of self-assurance.

The winter hibiscus will be monitored to observe if it can successfully seed and endure the necessary conditions to blossom into a flower for the upcoming year. This process will be repeated annually to track the plant's growth and development over time.

In "Winter Hibiscus," Minfong Ho concludes with a paragraph that symbolizes hope and renewal for the character Saeng. This resilience mirrors Saeng's own journey - though she may not be the same carefree individual she once was, she can endure tough times and eventually flourish again in the spring, ready to face the test once more. Thus, the final paragraph in "Winter Hibiscus" encapsulates the theme of renewal and optimism for Saeng's future.

Descriptive:  In the spring, I feel most comfortable. The geese will start honking and the hibiscus will begin to bud, and I can't wait. It is my favorite time of the year.

Saeng is feeling uncomfortable in her new surroundings and struggles to adapt to the changes since she moved. In an attempt to find comfort, she comes across a hibiscus plant that reminds her of her home in @LOCATION2. Despite the initial shock at the price she paid for the plant, Saeng's mother becomes more understanding when she realizes how much Saeng misses @LOCATION2. Saeng expresses her intention to retake her test in the spring, indicating a shift in her attitude towards living in @LOCATION1.
The author concludes that the geese are coming back in the story.

The author concludes that Saeng was determined not to give up by moving to a place she did not like and where she knew no one. The message conveyed is to have faith and not give up, as Saeng believed in herself and was determined to pass the test next time. This shows that being in an unfavorable situation does not mean one cannot persevere.

The author concludes the story in such a manner to emphasize the importance of perseverance in the face of failure. Saeng's determination to return and retake the test in the spring demonstrates a resilient attitude towards challenges. This decision highlights the idea that one should not give up easily when faced with setbacks, but instead continue to strive towards their goals. Life goes on, and by showing a willingness to try again, Saeng exemplifies a valuable lesson in resilience and determination.

The author concludes the story with this paragraph to demonstrate her determination not to succumb to homesickness. The first time she purchased that plant, it triggered memories of her former home, highlighting her longing for it. By expressing her willingness to redo the test, she signifies her refusal to be defeated by nostalgia in her new environment and life.

Saeng's determination to overcome obstacles is highlighted by her vow in the story. Despite feeling like a failure after failing her driving test, she finds courage in her hibiscus plant, symbolizing her ability to face challenges head-on. The geese in the story represent resilience and the importance of perseverance in the face of adversity. Through Saeng's journey, the author illustrates that with determination and a positive mindset, one can conquer any obstacle that comes their way.

The author concludes the story with this because the girl in the story is almost like the flower itself. Just as the flower will blossom, Saeng will take the test again, both receive a fresh start on things. Finishing the story this way left the reader feeling positive, it was a short ending but one with a lot of meaning. ì ...and this hibiscus is budding, then I will take that test again.î I think the last sentence is almost inspirational and it makes you want to start out fresh as well as Saeng.

When they return in the spring, when the snows melt and the geese come back, and this hibiscus is budding, then I will retake that test. There are several reasons for this decision. Firstly, I aim to continue adapting to my new life in Canada and embracing the cultural changes. Secondly, I want to handle the memory of my grandmother better and be able to cope with the wave of deep loss that still affects me. In doing so, I hope to signify that the story is far from over.

The narrator's decision to end the story with a paragraph about the hibiscus not returning until spring serves multiple purposes. It signifies the start of winter, highlighting the cyclical nature of the plant's bloom. Additionally, it effectively concludes the story by tying up the narrative thread related to the hibiscus. The short and succinct nature of the paragraph also serves as a fitting summary, providing a unique and unexpected ending to the story. Overall, there are several reasons why the narrator may have chosen to end the story in this manner.

Saeng, feeling disheartened after failing her driving test, finds solace in memories of the past when she sees a Hibiscus flower. The flower's resilience, as her mother describes it, gives Saeng the strength to renew her determination to succeed. With the promise of the Hibiscus blooming in the spring, Saeng is inspired to persevere and pass the test.

Saeng will need to focus more on improving her performance in school and less on her gardening activities. Saeng's personality in this story demonstrates determination and confidence. She appears to feel that she is capable of exploring more experienced activities related to different plants. Engaging in this hobby seems like a perfect fit for someone with a passion for plants. Saeng seems to have achieved her goals in planting, and she may be interested in pursuing a career in gardening. Her statement about taking the test again when the plants return indicates her willingness to further explore different types of plants. It is possible that Saeng inherited her love for planting from her mother, making it a family tradition. Saeng made a silent vow to herself to improve and shine like her mother, who had a delicate beauty that inspired her deeply. Despite failing a test and facing the cold winter season where plants struggled to grow, Saeng was determined to overcome these challenges and succeed. The hibiscus plant, which cost nineteen dollars, served as a reminder of her setbacks but also as a motivation to strive for better results in the future. Through hard work and perseverance, Saeng aimed to emulate her mother's strength and grace, ensuring that she would pass the test and flourish like the plants her mother nurtured with such care.

Saeng reflects on the winter scene around her, noting the hibiscus plant that she had forgotten about. The plant reminds her of her childhood and the resilience of her family. Despite failing her driver's test, Saeng is determined to try again in the spring when the snow melts, the geese return, and the hibiscus buds. The sight of the hibiscus serves as a symbol of perseverance and the strength to never give up, just like her family did when they moved to @LOCATION1 for a fresh start.

Saeng had failed her citizenship test, a significant setback that left her unable to even meet her mother's gaze. The purchase of a flower seemed to be a peace offering of sorts. Saeng vowed silently to herself that in the spring, when the snow melts and the geese return, and the hibiscus is budding, she will try to find a winter hibiscus that will bring back memories of her old home. She hopes and prays that the winter hibiscus will survive, and she will be able to take the test again with a flower that truly resembles what she remembers.

The author's hasty ending to the story was evident in the abrupt conclusion. It seemed like an attempt to quickly tie up loose ends without proper closure. This left the readers feeling unsatisfied and disconnected from the characters and plot. The rushed ending did not do justice to the intricate storyline that had been built throughout the narrative. It is essential for authors to take the time to craft a well-thought-out conclusion that provides resolution and leaves a lasting impact on the readers. Rushing the ending can detract from the overall quality of the story and leave a negative impression on the audience. In future works, the author should focus on developing a more satisfying and meaningful conclusion that complements the rest of the narrative.

When spring arrives and the snow melts away, she plans to sow new seeds in her garden. In the story "Winter Hibiscus" by Minfong Ho, the author concludes the narrative with a well-mannered resolution. Saeng, in the narrative, does not succeed in passing her driving test. On her way back home, she encounters a familiar plant, later identified as a hibiscus, at a florist's shop. Despite her limited financial resources, she purchases the plant as it evokes memories of her homeland and grandmother, whom she had to leave behind. Witnessing geese flying south for the winter, she mentally marks their return in the future, indicating a specific time frame. She commits to reattempting the driving test when the hibiscus blossoms, signifying the arrival of spring. With the winter months ahead, she plans to diligently prepare herself for the upcoming test, aiming to successfully pass it this time.

In the story "Winter Hibiscus," the protagonist decides to wait until the snow melts in the spring and the hibiscus plant she loves starts to bloom again before retaking a test. In the narrative "Hibiscus" by the author, the final paragraph was chosen due to its alignment with the overall tone, theme of hope, and representation within the essay. The story unfolds with a somber mood as the protagonist, Saeng, grapples with the disappointment of failing her driver's test. Memories of her homeland in Vietnam resurface when she encounters a winter hibiscus, prompting a wave of emotions. The text reads, "And in the warm moist shelter of the greenhouse, Saeng broke down and wept," illustrating the depths of her longing for her past life. As she reflects on the changes she has experienced, she realizes that the once unfamiliar has become almost comforting in its familiarity. The winter season intensifies her feelings of loss and despair, making it difficult for her to even speak the word "home" without succumbing to tears. The winter hibiscus serves as a poignant symbol of her inner turmoil and longing for a sense of belonging. Despite the heaviness of the narrative, the final paragraph hints at a glimmer of hope as Saeng looks ahead to the spring, suggesting that she will persevere and try again. The blending of tone, theme, and representation in the last paragraph encapsulates the emotional journey of the protagonist, making it a fitting conclusion to the narrative.

The author concludes the story with this paragraph for several reasons. The author concludes the story by expressing a sense of determination for the future, hinting at the possibility of retaking a test and striving for improvement. Saeng was deeply disappointed when she failed her driver's test. However, the hibiscus plant brought her joy and symbolized a new beginning in a new country. The author concludes this story with this paragraph because it signifies the cyclical nature of each year, with new beginnings and endings. The author concludes the story with the paragraph to show that Saeng has found comfort in the hibiscus and is now ready to retry the test with a more open mindset. The author of "Winter Hibiscus" concludes the story with a motivational paragraph to highlight Saeng's determination to adapt to her new life and home, overcoming common obstacles like a driver's test. Saeng found solace in the hibiscus flower after failing her driving test, as it reminded her of her homeland and brought back cherished memories. In "Winter Hibiscus" by Minfong Ho, Saeng's deep emotional connection to the memories evoked by the hibiscus plants is evident throughout the story. She mourns her grandmother and seeks solace in the memories brought back by the plants. Saeng's act of taking the plant to her mother, despite initial resistance, showcases her desire to share her emotions and seek understanding. As Saeng struggles with her test results, her mother's understanding and support provide comfort.
